intro: Baeria chrysostoma f. paleacea, commonly known as the pale-flowered baeria, is a rare and distinctive plant species within the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors or along stream banks. Its foliage has a delicate, aromatic scent, which is common among members of its family. The paleacea form is distinguished by its lighter floral coloration compared to the typical variety of Baeria chrysostoma.
